newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: AfDB gives Uganda $38.5 mln adjustment loan.
newsitem.headline: AfDB gives Uganda $38.5 mln adjustment loan.

text.p: The African Development Fund (ADF) has approved a loan of $38.5 million for Uganda to support its structural adjustment programme, the African Development Bank (AfDB) said on Wednesday.
The money will be disbursed in two equal tranches, and will provide balance of payments and budget support to help Uganda meet macroeconomic targets agreed with the International Monetary Fund.
It will also help the country improve the efficiency of its tax system and the management of the state budget.

The ADF is the development bank's soft loan window. Its loans are interest-free, although the borrower pays a service charge of 0.75 percent per annum. The money is repayable over 50 years, with 10 years grace.
